text:
Hello @everyone, I am new to this .

I need a help regarding how can we add/update and change the code of already developed and installed theme of HubSpot ?

What I am trying to do is we have got a  custom font that we would like to upload to the theme so that it appears on the font  dropdown option.  The used HubSpot theme is not developed by us .

How can I upload  my custom font to that theme .

Hey, folks, I'm stuck at the initial step. I have a developer account with super-admin, but I don't see a way to make a private app to have the api-key interact with the API so I can define scopes. It's not working with them being undefined so I either have to create a private app or define scopes account wide. I'm following this: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/migrate-an-api-key-integration-to-a-private-app> but I don't see integrations at all :confused:
How to create a private app?

API keys are deprecated.
Create a private app with the scopes you need instead, and use the private access token as a Bearer auth.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/private-apps>

Hello <@U04LEQY9AHX> To have access to the modification of themes that you have not developed.
You must clone the theme in question into a child theme.
Go to Marketing->Files and Templates->Design Tools

Then try to follow this guide <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/website-pages/use-fonts-in-HubSpot>

Hi, <@UCBDLK6SU>, I gathered as much. The problem is with these steps:
• In your HubSpot account, click the settings icon in the main navigation bar.
• In the left sidebar menu, navigate to Integrations > Private Apps.
I click the `settings`, but I don't have `Integrations`
You need Super Admin rights on the portal.
If you create a sandbox portal, which you should for testing, you’ll have these available:
OK, I see it. Thanks! I presume there's a way to interact with the real portal eventually, right?
Of course, you basically do the same steps in the real portal, to get private access token for the production portal.
Got it. Thanks, <@UCBDLK6SU>! :smile:

Hey everyone, I'm not sure if this is the right channel for this question but I couldn't find a more appropriate one. We are currently looking at a solution to automatically add TVA/TAX fields to Quotes in HubSpot but it seems like the option is not there and we always have to do it manually. Now, I searched around and found in the HubSpot Community forums that this feature is not there yet.

Has anyone found a work-around/solution to this and keen to share? Would love to get some takes on this.

Cheers!

Hi, I have a front-end with VueJS that uses VueRouter for navigation. When i navigate my Conversations widget doesnt update the conditional appearance that i specified in the HubSpot dashboard. If i refresh the page i see the correct appearance instead. What to do? I think it's because my router doesnt properly reload the page during the the transition
On route change you could try executing `window.HubSpotConversations.widget.refresh();` to refresh the widget (source: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/conversation/chat-widget-sdk>)

Anyone else experiencing the issue that the create button stays disabled when trying to create a multilanguage variation blog post (CMS Hub Starter / 5 languages)?

It works fine when I create the blog post and add it to the multilanguage group.
is it possible the Spanish variant already exists?
No and French didn't either
I created the blog in French and Spanish and added that to the multilanguage group
That worked fine
hmm, that is strange, I can test a Starter account to see if it happens
Just when trying to create the multilanguage variation, any language was disabled
I checked and adding a new language is working fine, the button changes when I add the new language - but I have to add at the blog level first, before it let's me make changes at the post level
Really odd! I'll try to see if the issue is still there tomorrow
Thanks for checking <@U03AKL6Q1B2>!
sorry I couldn't be more helpful, it might've been easier if it were consistent
Don't apologise! Thank you for taking the time
<@UDHT6N5SM> Do you have any projects that you can share? Thanks.
Same behaviour today, I'm not able to create multilanguage variation of blog posts
